Bitcoin’s ‘One Percent’ Controls Lion’s Share of the Cryptocurrency’s Wealth Paul Vigna2/9/2022

New research shows that just 0.01% of bitcoin holders controls 27% of the currency in circulation.

Financial Investment Services, Securities/Commodity Exchange Activities, Banking/Credit, Cryptocurrency Exchanges, Financial Services, Financial Technology, Investing/Securities, Technology, Virtual Currencies/Cryptocurrencies, Money/Currency Markets, Foreign Exchange Markets, Commodity/Financial Market News, Cryptocurrency Markets, Content Types, Factiva Filters, C&E Exclusion Filter, SYND, WSJ-PRO-WSJ.com, Elon Musk, money, currency markets, foreign exchange markets, commodity, financial market news, cryptocurrency markets, content types, factiva filters, c&e exclusion filter, financial investment services, securities, commodity exchange activities, banking, credit, cryptocurrency exchanges, financial services, financial technology, investing, technology, virtual currencies, cryptocurrenciesRead

<script>
if (window.PerformanceObserver) {
  
window._perfMarkAllowedList = [
  'cx-candybar-onload',
  'first-contentful-paint',
  'cx-candybar-onload',
  'gcRendererStart',
  'optimizely:blockBegin',
  'playerLoadStart',
  'playerReady',
  'playerDisplayed',
  'reactAppRenderStart',
  'reactAppRenderEnd'
];

  var observer = new PerformanceObserver(function (list) {
    var entries = list.getEntries();
    var _loop = function _loop(i) {
      var entry = entries[i];
      var metricName = entry.name;
      if ( window._perfMarkAllowedList.indexOf(entry.name) !== -1 ) {
        var time = Math.round(entry.startTime + entry.duration);
        if (metricName === 'gpt-slotOnload' ) {
          if (typeof newrelic !== 'undefined') {
             newrelic.setCustomAttribute(metricName, time);
          }
          setTimeout(function(){observer.disconnect()}, 8000)

        } else {
          if (typeof newrelic !== 'undefined') {
            newrelic.setCustomAttribute(metricName, time);
          }
        }
      }
    };

    for (var i = 0; i < entries.length; i++) {
      _loop(i);
    }

  });
  try {
    observer.observe({
      type: ['mark'], buffered: true
    });
  }
  catch(e) {
    console.log('observer not supported')
  }
}
</script>

    window.googletag = window.googletag || {};

      googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRequested', function(event) {
        if(!performance.getEntriesByName('gpt-slotRequested').length) {
         performance.mark('gpt-slotRequested');
        }
      });
      googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', function(event) {
        if(!performance.getEntriesByName('gpt-slotRenderEnded').length) {
          performance.mark('gpt-slotRenderEnded');
      }});
      googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotOnload', function(event) {
        if(!performance.getEntriesByName('gpt-slotOnload').length) {
          performance.mark('gpt-slotOnload');
      }});
    });

    Bitcoin’s ‘One Percent’ Controls Lion’s Share of the Cryptocurrency’s Wealth
  </h1>
  
    <h2 class="sub-head" itemprop="description">New research shows that just 0.01% of bitcoin holders controls 27% of the currency in circulation </h2>


</div>

</div> <!-- data-module-name="article.app/lib/module/wsj/articleHeadline" -->

  <div class="wsj-snippet-body">
         <p>It’s good to be the bitcoin 1%. The top bitcoin holders control a greater share of the cryptocurrency than the most affluent American households control in dollars, according to a study by the National Bureau of Economic Research.</p>
         <p>The study showed that the top 10,000 bitcoin accounts hold 5 million bitcoins, an equivalent of approximately $232 billion.</p>

readabilityObject.title: Bitcoin’s ‘One Percent’ Controls Lion’s Share of the Cryptocurrency’s Wealth
readabilityObject.content:
• Markets

New research shows that just 0.01% of bitcoin holders controls 27% of the currency in circulation

It’s good to be the bitcoin 1%. The top bitcoin holders control a greater share of the cryptocurrency than the most affluent American households control in dollars, according to a study by the National Bureau of Economic Research.

The study showed that the top 10,000 bitcoin accounts hold 5 million bitcoins, an equivalent of approximately $232 billion.
